examples.content:
Zomato just dropped a new app, and its's NOT about food or grocery delivery🤯

You see, they're about to change how you spend your weekends forever.

Here's why this is HUGE:

→ Ever juggled between 4-5 apps to plan a single night out? 
→ Dinner reservations in one app 
→ Movie tickets in another 
→ Event bookings somewhere else

Frustrating, right?

But that's about to change.

Zomato just invested ₹2,000+ crore to solve this nightmare.

The master stroke?

They acquired Paytm's ticketing business to create something revolutionary.

Picture this:

Book your favorite restaurant
Reserve movie tickets
Grab event passes
Track live shows
Discover trending spots

All. In. One. Place. 🚀

Think of it as your personal entertainment command center.

With 50M+ monthly active users, Zomato isn't just entering the entertainment space...

They're ready to dominate it. 👑

The best part?

They're leveraging their massive restaurant network to create an ecosystem BookMyShow never had.

But here's the real question:
Will this new super-app change how India plans its weekends? 🤔

Have you tried the app yet?

metadata.topic: Solving the problem of juggling between multiple apps to plan a day or event

examples.content:
Deepinder Goyal is stating a new startup 🔥

This time it’s not about food or anything around iy

Its about your health and mental wellness. 

He’s just launched a new venture called Continue, and here’s why this is going to be huge.

You know Deepinder as the guy who revolutionized food delivery with Zomato. 

Now, he’s taking his personal passion for health to the next level. 

This isn’t just a side project—it’s deeply personal for him. 

Continue is focused on health tracking and mental fitness, 

something he’s been vocal about being crucial to his own peak performance.

What’s fascinating is that this move isn’t tied to Zomato. 

It’s a personal venture, which means it’s driven entirely by his commitment to wellness. 

Goyal has often shared how time with his wellness team is like therapy—

it helps him avoid burnout, stay focused, and keep performing at his best. 

Now, he wants to bring that same level of insight and innovation to everyone.

Continue is still in its early stages, 

but the buzz around it is already massive. 

Early reports are calling it the “Ultimate Health Tracker”, and knowing Deepinder, this won’t just be another run-of-the-mill app. 

His track record of building Zomato from scratch to a multi-billion-dollar company speaks for itself—

when he starts something, he’s in it to disrupt industries.

But here’s where it gets even more interesting. 

Deepinder has already made moves in the health-tech space, investing in Ultrahuman, a company that develops wearables to track your mental and physical well-being. 

So, Continue is just the next step in what seems to be his bigger plan to transform how we think about health.

Zomato’s been diversifying like crazy—food delivery, quick commerce with Blinkit, and now this. 

It’s clear that Deepinder isn’t just sticking to one lane, and that’s what makes him such a compelling entrepreneur. 

He’s all about impact, and with Continue, he’s bringing that same drive to the wellness industry.

So, the big question is: 

how is Continue going to change the way we take care of ourselves? 

Only time will tell, but with Deepinder behind it, one thing’s for sure—this is just the beginning.

What do you think? 

Could this be the next big shift in health tech? 

Let me know your thoughts in the comments! 👇

Bangalore is getting flying electric taxis! 🚁⚡

While Silicon Valley had its self-driving cars, 

Bangalore is taking urban mobility to the skies with flying taxis.

Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) just announced a groundbreaking partnership with Sarla Aviation to introduce electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft. 

This is set to make Kempegowda International Airport India’s first eVTOL-friendly airport.

And it’s not just a cool concept—it’s going to change your daily commute 👇

Here’s how it works:

🚗 A trip from Indiranagar to the airport that normally takes 1.5 hours…
✈️ …will now take just 5 minutes.

Yes, 5 minutes instead of battling through endless traffic! 🤯

But that’s not all…

This futuristic ride is also cheaper than your current taxi fare. 💰

 • Taxi fare today: ₹2,500 ( with surge )
 • Flying taxi fare: ₹1,700

You’re getting there faster, cheaper, and in an eco-friendly way. 🌱 These electric aircraft run on clean energy, produce minimal noise, and create zero emissions.

The best part?

The eVTOLs will accommodate 7 passengers, fly at 250 km/h, and cover 160 km on a single charge. 

With plans to offer ride-sharing services similar to Uber and Ola, flying to the airport will soon be as easy as booking a cab. 🚖➡️✈️

But, there’s a catch…

Before these flying taxis take over, we still need regulatory approvals and infrastructure development, 

which could take another 2 years.

Would you line up to give flying taxi a shot?

metadata.topic: Flying taxis in Bangalore coming soon

examples.content:
Ever wondered why a behemoth like Meta (earlier Facebook) is encountering frequent outages with WhatsApp? What’s the real reason behind them? And is it time to switch to a more reliable platform?

It’s the second time in less than a year that Meta’s services have suffered a global blackout. In Oct 2021, all three platforms – Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp – suffered a nearly 7 hr outage, followed by the recent outage of WhatsApp in India for nearly 2 hrs affecting more than 500 Mn users.

According to a recent analysis by Bloomberg, Meta’s biggest bet of $19 Bn, WhatsApp could wind up more valuable as a sacrifice to regulators than as a viable business.

Key Reasons:
1) WhatsApp’s role as an earnings void than a money maker like Instagram, while WeChat – another messaging competitor in China – generated upwards of $500Mn in June 2022 alone
2) Limited clarity on turning WhatsApp into a viable Business Model – First by trying to monetize the app with Ads and then by charging businesses to engage with customers
3) Zuckerberg's changing vision – first from privacy-oriented social networking in March 2021 to an immersive world of Metaverse in just 7 months

Additionally, Zukerberg’s primary motive for buying WhatsApp was to fend it off as a competitive threat, and the recent mounting pressure from Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to divest WhatsApp and Instagram concretely explains Zuckerberg's lack of drive to invest and improve his biggest bet.

Quickly closing the chapter on WhatsApp might highlight an unsettling truth for Meta’s investors but it seems the investors' community has already spotted it, and the same is getting reflected in Meta’s stock price - The company can’t seem to make money from anything other than traditional online advertising.

PS: Factors like Apple’s Ad tracking feature and rising competition in the attention market from TikTok, Youtube, Netflix, etc. are also playing a significant role in the decline of the stock price of Meta.

What do you think are some of the other reasons and what the future holds for WhatsApp and Meta?

hashtag#business hashtag#india hashtag#meta hashtag#whatsapp hashtag#outage
